name: cataclysmically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that causes a lot of destruction or a sudden, violent change: Many wondered how the monumental twin towers could be toppled so easily and cataclysmically. We need an inquiry into what went so cataclysmically wrong.
More examplesFewer examplesBy a literal interpretation of Plato's chronology, Atlantis was destroyed cataclysmically around 9500-9600 B.C.Set in an isolated farming community, the plot focuses on a series of characters who become cataclysmically connected. So it was that we set off along a path which was to end so cataclysmically nine years later. A project that has been our entire focus for a year and a half has been cataclysmically unsuccessful.During a cataclysmically destructive event, an observant bystander happened to be in the right place at the right time.
